drupalNodeEvent.title: Matrix Barcodes, Swapped Faces and Thousand-Mile Eyes: Machine Vision in Chinese Everyday Life

field_speakers.processed: Dr Gabriele de Seta, University of Bergen

field_description.processed: This talk will discuss the role of machine vision in Chinese everyday life through three cases studies: the success of QR codes and other data encoding patterns as infrastructural gateways; the popularization and regulation of deepfakes; and the controversies around the deployment of increasingly pervasive biometric identification systems.
